body: I mean can we do something to make Riot change their mind? it has been a long time waiting for a high quality skin for Vayne(Arclight Vayne lost Vayne's dark-themed concept so I don't like that). and it's too desperate to know that Soulstealer Vayne will be a  crafting exclusive skin, just like Hextech Annie! this means we Vayne main must cost $300 to get this... replies.body:
Hey DeepnessInSky - 

Unfortunately, we won't be changing how players can obtain this particular skin.

... why? What's the rationale to keep this skin Hextech exclusive? The general consensus for Hextech Annie was that it was suited to be a crafting exclusive due to the theme, and it is largely respected as a rare and valuable skin because of it. This seems to be done to arbitrarily increase the value of Soulstealer Vayne. Why not keep making more Hextech skins and dedicate them to this system instead? This only seems to be setting grounds for a dangerous precedent which would allow Riot to boost skin value by putting them behind a grind/paywall.

I'm not the best person to answer this, but I'd be happy to drop in Riot Wingfield's reply, which may explain what we have planned in the future for Hextech Crafting and exclusive skins. 

*"Hey All! *

*Just wanted to give some extra context here. Soul Stealer Vayne is a new Hextech Crafting exclusive skin. You can obtain her as a rare shard drop from a mastery chest or by forging 10 gemstones. When you "forge" gemstones you get to choose the exclusive item you want to unlock. 
So if you have 10 gemstones, you can choose Hextech Annie or Soul Stealer Vayne. *

***We plan on adding new rare content a few times a year and these items won't always be in the Hextech theme (as with Vayne, duh ;) ***

*We also know that as we add more of these rare items, it can be challenging to obtain them. In future Hextech Crafting promotions we will **sometimes offer guaranteed pathways to a limited number of gemstones. We want to carefully balance not making these items too rare while also not invalidating rarity as a valuable content feature within League**. *

*Hope that context helps a bit :)*
*Wingfield"*

[Source](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/4o34bf/pbe_preview_soul_stealer_vayne/d49ffu1).

The droprate for gemstones is estimated at 1 in 25 chests from a number of players who opened many chests on the PBE as well as players opening chests after the system went live. The odds of attaining the skin through a shard or reroll is around 1 in 600 (the number of skins in the game) and as such is much too small to be a relevant factor.

The most well-known example is Anniebot who had to open 328 chests to get hextech annie over the course of a couple weeks.

The price of hextech chests is fixed.
The rate at which you acquire them without money is fixed.
The odds are pretty much completely known at this point, the margin of error is small.

And even if the margin of error were MUCH larger than expected, something absolutely ridiculous like 50%, the numbers (150 dollars or 2.5 years) would still be completely unreasonable.
